meanings.sent1: The bouncer had to exclude the underage individuals from entering the club.
meanings.sent2: Please exclude any unauthorized personnel from the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to exclude the other animals from the treehouse.
meanings.sent4: Her strict diet excludes any sugary treats, making her healthier.
meanings.sent5: The security system is set up to automatically exclude any unknown visitors.

meanings.sent1: Don't forget to exclude the unnecessary details from your report.
meanings.sent2: When writing a summary, it's important to exclude minor points.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to exclude the spicy ingredient from the recipe, making it milder.
meanings.sent4: She chose to exclude her ex-friend from the guest list for the party.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will exclude the last question from the test since it was too difficult.

meanings.definition: Prevent from entering or being included.
meanings.sent1: The locked gate will exclude any unauthorized vehicles from entering the premises.
meanings.sent2: To maintain order, the school must exclude disruptive students from the event.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to exclude the rabbit until it magically appeared.
meanings.sent4: His shy nature tends to exclude him from group activities.
meanings.sent5: The strict dress code will exclude anyone not wearing formal attire from the gala.
